titleStmt.title: The true picture and relation of Prince Henry his noble and vertuous disposition containing certaine observations and proofes of his towardly and notable inclination to vertue, of the pregnancie of his wit, farre above his age, comprehended in sundry of his witty and pleasant speaches. By W.H. With the true relation of the sicknesse and death of the same most illustrious prince, vvith the opening of his body. Written by a famous doctor of physick in French, and newly translated into English.
titleStmt.author: W. H., fl. 1634.
Haydone, William.
Mayerne, Théodore Turquet de, Sir, 1573-1655.

notesStmt.note: A famous doctor of physick = Sir Théodore Turquet de Mayerne.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
